body_html: It is not a bug. Most functions in tf including placeholder and variable mutates the current default graph by adding new operations to it. When you create mu for the second time, the first mu is still there, waiting to be initialized by the first sample_data. That is why you encounter the error, for you do not feed the old sample_data.
body_text: It is not a bug. Most functions in tf including placeholder and variable mutates the current default graph by adding new operations to it. When you create mu for the second time, the first mu is still there, waiting to be initialized by the first sample_data. That is why you encounter the error, for you do not feed the old sample_data.
body: It is not a bug. Most functions in tf including `placeholder` and `variable` mutates the current default graph by adding new operations to it. When you create `mu` for the second time, the first `mu` is still there, waiting to be initialized by the first `sample_data`. That is why you encounter the error, for you do not feed the old `sample_data`.
